image.altText: A wide shot of Len La Tous's devastated home from the Christmas Day storms.

props.synopsis: More intense storms are forecast to hit south-east Queensland on the weekend, just days after the region endured several deadly weather systems, including a "mini cyclone".

title.children: More storms, heatwaves inbound for south-east Queensland after region cops destructive tornado

image.altText: A man with stretchers, a septum ring and long grey hair and a beard.

props.synopsis: A US man connected to religious extremists who killed three people in Queensland's Western Downs last year is seeking to have charges against him dismissed.

title.children: Man arrested in connection with Wieambilla terror attack seeks to have charges dismissed on basis of free speech

image.altText: Woman weep opening whle wearing black and yellow sashes while holding pictures of three people

props.synopsis: Australian man Ali Bazzi, who Hezbollah said was a fighter, and his brother Ibrahim, along with Ibrahim's wife Shorouk Hammoud, died when the explosion levelled a family-owned home in southern Lebanon on Tuesday.

title.children: Military-style funeral held for Australian 'Hezbollah fighter' killed by Israeli air strike in Lebanon

image.altText: The sun sets over a remote ocean bay with cliffs along the perimeter.

props.synopsis: Police say emergency services are responding to reports a person has been seriously injured in a shark attack off South Australia's Yorke Peninsula.

title.children: Person 'seriously injured' in shark attack off coast of Yorke Peninsula, police say

image.altText: An Aboriginal man holding a carved wooden dog inside a workshed.

props.synopsis: Ancient craftsmanship collides with augmented reality in an art project taking the world-renowned 'Ku' dog sculptures of Aurukun into a new dimension with the next generation of artists.

title.children: ​​​​​​​From milkwood trees to a tablet and stylus, iconic dog sculptures get new life in digital art

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: An old stone building with a vineyard.

props.synopsis: Tourism leaders say South Australia's Limestone Coast needs more accommodation to suit a range of budgets to reach its full potential as a holiday destination.

title.children: It has world-class wines and scenery galore, but a lack of tourist beds could be holding this region back

image.altText: Two bottles of Yakult - the probiotic drink - posed on a kitchen table for a marketing photo

props.synopsis: Probiotic company Yakult Australia is hit by a cyber attack, resulting in 95 gigabytes of data, including sensitive employee data, being published on the dark web, the ABC can confirm.

title.children: Employee files published on dark web after Yakult Australia targeted in cyber attack

image.altText: a flight attendant talks to passengers while walking down the aisle of a plane

props.synopsis: As any frequent social media user knows, airline passengers often record and post in-flight incidents — from frightening turbulence to unruly travellers. The trend is now emerging as an industrial issue.

title.children: 'You don't know why they're filming': Flight attendants filmed without their consent for viral videos

image.altText: A large hailstone being held in a person's hand.

props.synopsis: Massive storms across Australia have left giant hailstones in people's backyards. Scientists hope you won't let them melt and will instead preserve the icy lumps for weather research.

title.children: Do you have giant hailstones at your place? Don't just take photos, put them in your freezer for science

image.altText: A rural road with large trees lining it.

props.synopsis: A child has died at a private property in Victoria's north after being struck by a large tree branch, police say.

title.children: Child dies after being struck by falling tree branch in Victoria's north

image.altText: Lightning explodes over power lines.

props.synopsis: Power outages are affecting thousands of residents across the country. With more stormy weather on the way, there's a chance you could find yourself in a prolonged blackout. Here are some tips on what to do.

title.children: You could be impacted by a power outage. Here's how to stay safe and comfortable

image.altText: Simi Gill sits on a chair near a clothesline with grape vines in the background near Barmera, South Australia, November 2023.

props.synopsis: Its water creates a home, a playground and a food bowl – but those who live on the Murray believe it can be managed better. We take a look at life on Australia's longest river.

title.children: The Murray is a lifeline for Australia's food and water supply, but the climate's changing

image.altText: Two huge sailing yachts on the River Derwent with Hobart behind them.

props.synopsis: The owner of the victorious Sydney to Hobart yacht thinks it's "rough as anything", despite pulling off a nailbiting finish in slow motion. So how did LawConnect do it?

title.children: How two days of sailing came down to just 51 seconds in Sydney to Hobart nailbiter

image.altText: Signage on a glass fronted building reads 'The New York Times' in a calligraphic font

props.synopsis: The New York Times is taking legal action against Microsoft and OpenAI over their artificial intelligence-powered programs. This is what it alleges the chatbots are up to.

title.children: 'The cost to society will be enormous': Here's why the New York Times has just sued two tech titans

image.altText: Mitch Marsh plays a pull shot

props.synopsis: Mitch Marsh and Steve Smith are rebuilding Australia's second innings on day three after the top order's collapse. Follow all the updates from the MCG in our live blog.

title.children: Mitch Marsh scores 50 after astonishing reprieve to give Australia life on day three

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fifty for Mitch Marsh! And what a time to do it
BOWLED HIM! HAMZA ON A HATTRICK!

image.altText: An in-flight picture of an airliner over a beach, the plane in purple and white livery showing the word "Bonza".

props.synopsis: Bonza customers receive text messages notifying them their flights between Darwin and the Gold Coast are cancelled until March 19, nearly a month after the airline cancelled all its flights along the route for December.

title.children: Bonza extends its cancellation of all flights on Darwin-Gold Coast route until mid-March

image.altText: A firefighter works to rescue a man inside a badly damaged truck under a bridge

props.synopsis: Two men scouting for fishing spots in north-west Indiana discover a badly damaged truck beneath a highway bridge, with a man barely alive inside.

title.children: Man survives on rainwater for six days trapped inside truck crashed under US bridge

image.altText: A split picture, with an NFL quarterback wearing his helmet on one side, and a tennis player on court about to hit a return.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic is getting ready for next month's Australian Open, looking to add to his men's record haul of 24 major singles titles — and in a warning to his rivals, he says he wants to match NFL great Tom Brady by playing into his 40s.

title.children: Novak Djokovic hoping to play into his 40s like good friend Tom Brady

image.altText: A bald white man with a sleeve tattoo with a guitar wearing a white jacket playing in front of a crowd as the sun sets

props.synopsis: Hosting two of the most remote music festivals in the country comes with added challenges when things go wrong, but the RFDS is never too far away, with patrons showing their appreciation by raising more than $1 million for the healthcare service.

title.children: Outback music festivals raise more than $1 million for Royal Flying Doctor Service

image.altText: Three Indian warships sailing in a line.

props.synopsis: Two of the world's busiest shipping lanes are under threat in the Middle East. Here's why India felt the need to send its warships in.

title.children: Pirates and rebels on the seas: Why India is sending three warships west

image.altText: A family is checked by an official near a truck.

props.synopsis: The Rafah crossing is one of the few bridges between Gaza and the world outside. For Sahar Ramy and her family, it was their only means of escape to Egypt.

title.children: With her pink suitcase, Sahar risked death to escape Gaza. Now her real struggle begins

image.altText: An aerial view of a power plant in japan near the ocean

props.synopsis: Japan's nuclear power regulator has lifted an operational ban on Tokyo Electric Power's Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant, as the company turns its attention to getting local permission to restart.

title.children: Regulators have lifted a ban on world's largest nuclear power station. But will Japanese locals give it a tick of approval?

image.altText: The exterior of Lismore Base Hospital with a helipad on top of a multistorey building and ambulances parked at street level.

props.synopsis: Police say the child was given CPR by family members after being found in the water at Whian Whian, north of Lismore, but could not be revived.

title.children: Two-year-old girl dies in hospital after being pulled from backyard pool in northern NSW

image.altText: A profile photo of a young woman with dark hair

props.synopsis: A series of "missed opportunities" at Royal Perth Hospital cost 26-year-old Geraldton woman Ashleigh Hunter any chance of survival from a meningococcal infection, the WA coroner finds.

title.children: Critically ill woman denied any 'opportunity to survive' as she waited for help at Perth hospital, coroner finds

image.altText: Sign telling people to ignore GPS instructions in Quairading.

props.synopsis: A shire in Western Australia's Wheatbelt has erected signs warning travellers to ignore GPS directions as they are sending drivers to unsealed, often treacherous roads.

title.children: 'Your GPS is wrong': Council acts after Google maps repeatedly sends drivers onto unsafe roads

image.altText: A boy in front of trees

props.synopsis: Since 1996, the Japanese video game franchise has taken the world by storm, with Australia now playing host to many of the very best players in the world.

title.children: Meet the Australians having an outsized impact on the competitive world of Pokémon

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The local share market has risen to its highest level since April 2022, while the Australian dollar is trading at its highest level in five months on expectations of steep US interest rate cuts next year. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises to fresh 20-month high, as markets bet on interest rate cuts in 2024

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Share market closes just below record-high
Limestone Coast tourism leaders say accommodation shortage for visitors is stunting region's growth

image.altText: A Rohingya Muslim woman wearing hijab cries while holding her child close

props.synopsis: Indonesian students storm a convention centre housing hundreds of Rohingya refugees from Myanmar in Banda Aceh, demanding they be deported.

title.children: Rohingya families forced from Indonesian refugee shelter in 'mob attack'

image.altText: Composite image of Lisa Marie Presley, Burt Bacharach and Tina Turner.

props.synopsis: From punk rockers to crooners, best friends to magicians, the world lost some well known faces and creative geniuses this year.

title.children: Looking back at the celebrities who died this year
